fields.description:
In JIRA 4.2, subtask quickcreate horizontal is out-of-alignment (refer to screenshot: subtask_quickcreate_horizontal.png).

Only happen when the browser window is too small. If I use a bigger monitor and resize the browser width to be longer, then it will be fine (refer to screenshot: after_resized.png)

*Workaround*:
Use subtask quickcreate vertical (refer to screenshot: subtask_quickcreate_vertical.png):
# Stop JIRA
# Modify {{<jira_install>\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\jira-application.properties}} and change the *quickcreationform-horizontal.vm* to *quickcreationform-vertical.vm*:
{noformat}
# This template formats the subtask quick creation form that appears on the View Issue page.
# Horizontal and vertical forms are provided (vertical works better if fields need labels or use textareas)
jira.subtask.quickcreateform.template = templates/jira/issue/subtask/quickcreationform-vertical.vm
# jira.subtask.quickcreateform.template = templates/jira/issue/subtask/quickcreationform-horizontal.vm
{noformat}
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA 4.2 subtask quickcreate horizontal out-of-alignment

fields.description:
(i) The History Tab shows all changes. 

By default it is sorted: "Oldest change on top; latest at bottom"
The topmost change shows in bold a kind of "title bar": "Field     Original Value        New Value" (/)

(x) When I now invert the sort order this title bar is at the very bottom of the page. You can only guess "Is the left col the old or the new value???"

=> Please keep the title bar always on the top; independent from any sorting.
=> In addition this title bar seem to be INSIDE the first change note instead of OVER all changes.

TNX,
 Markus
fields.summary: History Tab inconsistent when changing the sort order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23026].
  {panel}

GreenHopper allows for multiple-line summaries (which JIRA doesn't appear to by itself) but they break email notifications, especially HTML-formatted ones. From within JIRA and GreenHopper they look fine:

!gh-edit.png!

!gh-created.png!

!jira-summary.png!

But when email notifications are sent they look like this:

!gh-notification.png!

Text-only notifications are less broken-looking, with just the extra email headers shown at the top.
fields.summary: Multiple-line issue summary created in GreenHopper breaks email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23025].
  {panel}

The jql autocomplete parser has some weird behaviour around reserved characters see JRA-22927. Full-stops are not an uncommon things in version numbers.

Right now if one has versions 4.0, 4.0.1, 4.1 and 4.2. And types 'affectedVersion = 4.0' 4.1 and 4.2 will still be in the list but there will be an ! at the top of the jql parser box.

If you type 'affectedVersion = "4.0' (note the double-quote (") is not yet closed), the autocomplete list will be winnowed down to just 4.0 and 4.0.1 but there will be an ! at the top of the jql parser box.

If you type 'affectedVersion = ""' and then within the "" type 4.0 the list will be winnowed down to 4.0 and 4.0.1 and the jql parser will keep its tick. 

I would expect that all three would behave the same way. With perhaps the first 2 keeping the ! as the value is not quoted correctly.
fields.summary: JQL parser should handle reserved characters better and more consistently.
JIRA data anonymiser doesn't anonymise non-English characters
Emphasise on a need of granting the Browse project permission in order to the depending permissions take effect.
Implement a permission check framework for depending permissions
Enabling Crowd SSO with JIRA 4.2 results in inability to log in at all

fields.description:
v4.1.1#522


When I press 'comment', write lengthy comment, sometimes I accidently press 'comment' again not 'add' (Because of the layot, and button caption "comment" somehow instinctively suggests that comment will be added). In this case comment text is lost. It would be nice, that in these cases comment text would not be lost, but reappear when I press 'comment' again or jira could warn me that the text is going to be lost.

please see screenshot:

fields.description:
I would like to have a way to adapt fields in my edit issue page from a value in a select list.

For exemple 
I select a value in the select list, it displays two input field (with label)
I select another value in the select list it displays tree input fields (with label) 
Another display only one input field
By default no input field are displayed

When I change selected value, the input field values replace the previous in database.

Is it possible ?

It allow me to avoid to create lof of projects with a different edit screen definition and custom fields.
fields.summary: Is a way to develop a dynamic multi  custom field

fields.description:
After creating a Custom field and typing in the Description of the Custom Field the following String value "<!--", next time i open up the Custom Fields View, everything what is listed after the previously added Custom Field, doesn't appear.

I think you have to just add a input check and filter out i.e. comment tags like "<!--".

Best regards
Hossein Ghodrati
zeb/information.technology

fields.description:
A customer was asking for integration between JIRA & Basecamp. Different departments in the company use different tools and thus the need for some form of integration.

I'm creating this ticket so customers can vote for it and add ideas for how the integration could work. 

One integration idea:

* Replicate basecamp issue in JIRA and retain link between them
* Resolving issues in JIRA result in completed tasks in Basecamp
fields.summary: Create integration between JIRA & Basecamp

fields.description: I would like to create an Intranet page, with the look-and-feel of the CTG Products site (http://i2.adb.pl/ctg_product_guide/). This would serve as a visual repository for some of the documents that we are currently producing (e.g., Carbo selling material).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23013].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
 Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
The application of the auto-complete renderer to the fix/affected versions field and components field is a welcome addition to Jira.
 What would be even more useful is if the auto-complete renderer could also be applied to any multi-select and/or multi-checkboxes custom field.
 We've got one particularly large multi-checkboxes custom field that has options added to it at a rate of 1 or 2 options a week. As it stands it causes major screen real estate problems when using "simple" searching. 
 The "advanced" searching JQL auto-complete actually already offers auto-complete for the field in question, but for our less advanced users, we'd love to see something closer to the components/versions/labels auto-completion style in the simple searching (and general issue editing/moving) views.
h3. Workaround

The multi select field renderer can be changed by enabling "multiselect.frother.renderer" [dark feature|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!Default.jspa]
fields.summary: Allow multi-select and multi-checkboxes custom field types to use auto-complete renderer
Comment Author field should be included in Text Search when "Comments" is checked

fields.description:
in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.service.ProjectServiceImpl, methods public RemoteProject createProject(User user, RemoteProject rProject) and public RemoteProject updateProject(User user, RemoteProject rProject) have a call to validation:
com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.ProjectService.[Create/Update]ProjectValidationResult result =
                projectService.validateUpdateProject(user, rProject.getName(), rProject.getKey(), rProject.getDescription(),
                        rProject.getLead(), rProject.getProjectUrl(), null);
Last parameter (Long AssigneeType) is set to NULL, so one can't create project with specific assigneeType, and, more importantly, on any project update assignee type is reset to NULL (Unassigned).
There should really be additional field in RemoteProject class - assignee type.
fields.summary: Strange behavior in creating and updating projects via SOAP
test

fields.description:
Request the ability to customize the columns displayed in a filter.  The displayed columns can already be customised on a per-project or per-user basis - why not add the ability to customise for a filter?
Use case: if I create custom fields in my project to hold metadata about development tasks,I may want to show them in filters designed for use by the developers, but not for those shown to the end users.
This request was originally raised 7 years ago as JRA-626, which was incorrectly (in my view) closed as a duplicate.
fields.summary: Customize filter columns - still wanted

fields.description:
Hello,

Today, the only way of adding a block of custom text to the top of a subscription email is by editing the template file {{atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.1.2-standalone\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\templates\email\html\filtersubscription.vm}}.

But the problem is that, when a customer needs to change this block of custom text many times a day, he needs to always restart his JIRA instance, so this solution doesn't really work.

It would be great if there was a way to configure this through the Administration GUI.

A suggestion is to add a variable somewhere in the {{filtersubscription.vm}}, for example ${subscriptionText}, that displays what was configured in the Administration GUI. If nothing is configured in the Administration GUI, this variable is left blank.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Custom text on subscription e-mails configured through Admin GUI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22999].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

JIRA generates invalid XML/RSS feed output for the *Export Search as RSS* feature under certain conditions.

h3. Symptoms

Trying to consume the XML/RSS output will fail for most applications. e.g. if you try to consume this from Confluence's JIRA Issues Macro, it will not work.

h3. Details

h4. Example -- labels with double hyphen

# Have a label with a double hyphen in it, e.g. "a--a".
# Go to Labels Heatmap and click that label.
# Switch to RSS view.

Observe: incorrect XML. Google Chrome shows an error message like this:

{{error on line 7 at column 138: Comment not terminated}}

The parse error is caused by the very first comment in the generated XML. It contains an example URL, and that URL contains your label, which in turn contains two hyphens in a row, which is forbidden by the XML spec (chapter 2.5).

h4. Example -- URL contains double hyphen

If your JIRA instance URL has a double hyphen in it, e.g. {{my--site.atlassian.net}}, this will trigger the same as above.

h3. Work around

There is no work around.
fields.summary: Search for a label containing double hyphen generates bad XML in RSS view

fields.description: Create a filter based on a field such as "environment", and raise 23 issues spread as 18 open, 4 closed and 1 "awaiting system test".  If this is applied to a filter, then statistics in a chart displayed, the rounding used in Jira rounds the values as follows: 18 = 78%, 4 = 17% and 1 = 4%.  78+17+4 = 99%.  It is even worse if you have 6 statuses and the defects are evenly spread - each categpory is 16.666%, or 17% in Jira.  6 x 17 = 102%
fields.summary: Statistic charts in Jira have a flaw in the rounding algorithm used

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
1. Create a project with versions A, B, C, D, and E (or 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, etc), A being the first version and E being the last. 
2. Create a six issues, the first with fix version as A, the second as B, and so on, then one with the fix version as A _and_ E.
3. In the Issue Navigator, run the following JQL query: {{fixVersion >= "B" AND fixVersion <= "D"}}

*Expected results*:
The issues with fix version B, C, and D are returned.

*Actual results*:
The issues with fix versions B, C, and D are indeed returned, but so is the issue with fix versions A and E.

The same issue occurs if you use just < and > instead of >= and <=.
fields.summary: JQL query "fixVersion >= B AND fixVersion <= D" returns unexpected results

fields.description: The 4.2 documentation says that CreateIssueHandler will use the user specified by the reporterusername parameter "for emails whose sender does not match that of an existing user".  The handler does appear to behave that way, but it does so even for deactivated users, which seems wrong.  If a user has been removed from all groups and roles, and then the handler receives an e-mail from the address associated with that user, it will still attempt to create an issue with that user, but it will always fail because the user is deactivated and therefore doesn't have permission to create issues.  It would be more logical to have the handler fall back to the reporterusername when there is no existing *active* user with an e-mail address matching the sender.
fields.summary: reporterusername ignored when handling e-mail from address associated with deactivated user

fields.description: Have a label like "<R&D>" or ";-)". They're absent from the Labels Heatmap when you select "All Labels", though they're present in "Popular Labels" (if popular).
fields.summary: Labels Heatmap doesn't show labels starting with a non-alphanumeric character in All Labels

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1.) Go to Administration -> Custom Fields -> Field Configuration
2.) Click on a Field Configuration to access "http://dev-jira.ops.ag.com/secure/admin/ConfigureFieldLayout"

What I expected to see:
A table displaying links to everything customizable within this field configuration.

What I saw instead:
A table displaying links to everything customizable within this field configuration... and a "Screens" column, whose links take you to the same page as when you click Custom Fields -> Screens.  This makes it seem like you can modify Field -> Screen associations on a per-Field Configuration basis, which is incorrect.

The relationship between schemes, screens and fields is not made clear by the Jira administration interface.  That's okay.  But including the "Screens" column on the Field Configuration page actually makes it *less* clear.
fields.summary: Global "Screens" property for fields should not appear in Field Configuration View

fields.description:
It would be usefull to see the last run status in the CVS-Modules overview. Mabe indicated either red if an error occoured or green if anything went right.
It should have included a link to the last error report if an error occoured.

Currently it is only shown in catalina.out and has to be parsed manually for errors.
fields.summary: Show status of cvs-log retrieval in the CVS-Modules overview

fields.description:
1) Set up JIRA from scratch in Japanese. The default encoding is Shift_JIS.
2) Create a project and an issue.
3) Add a comment to the issue using the comment dialog　(all dialogs are affected, this is the simplest repro step). Write your comment in Japanese. 
!Encoding1.png!
4) Submit the comment.
5) Look at the characters in the new comment on the view issue page. They are different.
!Encoding2.png!

There appears to be an encoding mixup here. All dialogs are in UTF-8 and the View Issue page is Shift_JIS, but the data isn't being correctly converted from one to the other.

When the dialog is submitted, it POSTs the data as URL-encoded UTF-8:
!Encoding3.png!

When the View Issue page is generated, it drops those UTF-8 bytes into a Shift_JIS page without converting to Shift_JIS:
!Encoding4.png!

------------------------------

By contrast, it works fine if you submit the same comment using the bottom comment box, which is non-dialog.

!Encoding5.png!
becomes
!Encoding6.png!

In this case, the POST is done as URL-encoded Shift-JIS:
!Encoding7.png!

Which then fits nicely into the Shift_JIS-encoded View Issue Page:
!Encoding8.png!
fields.summary: Data submitted via dialogs in Japanese (Shift_JIS) systems is corrupted

fields.description:
Currently when you resolve an issue say as a duplicate, you want to also link it to another issue.  However you need to do this in 2 actions, either before or after the transition.

We need a system field that can "link" an issue just like the link issue dialog but in field form and hence it can go on a transition screen.

This would basically be all the functionality of the current link issue page.
fields.summary: Create an IssueLinkingSystemField to allow issues to be linked on a transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22974].
  {panel}

We have a number of projects with components. Since Jira does not support subcomponents, we maintain a hierarchy while creating components. For example:  A component called CompA with subcomponents will be created as 
CompA - SC1
CompA - SC2
CompA - SC3
Now, when we do a JQL Search, we want to search by specifying  Components LIKE "CompA"  which should return all issues with all components starting with CompA. Due to this missing feature, we now have to list all component names which is tedious since we sometimes have 20 subcomponents to a component.
fields.summary: Need support for LIKE operator in JQL
Autocomplete Assignees

fields.description: We need to restrict the available issue types options by project role. We have plenty of cases where we don't want certain users to create certain types of issues belonged to a particular issue type scheme.
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme by Project Role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22970].
  {panel}

Hello,

When changing the Security Scheme of a project, while it is running, if any user tries to access any issue within this project, he gets a 'Permission Violation' error. This seems like a rather harsh way of telling the users that the security scheme of this project have changed.

Worst case scenario, with a project with thousands of issues, this process takes quite a while to complete. And, in this whole time the process is taking place, the users get a 'Permission Violation' exception, where there should be a message much like the reindex message (when a user tries to do any action while the reindexing is taking place, he doesn't get a 'ugly' message, but instead a nice "the reindexing is taking place, please wait".

Based on the ticket:

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-67441

Cheers 
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: When the security scheme of a project, permission violation is thrown without warning to users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hello Atlassian,

until version 4.0.2 there was an Announcement Banner *Preview* Option.
Nowadays (in 4.2) there is only "Set Banner" available.

Please fix this issue in next release. Thanks!

BR,
 Markus

PS: Having a "hidden" checkbox as suggested [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+an+Announcement+Banner?focusedCommentId=226166438#comment-226166438] would be quite useful, too.
fields.summary: Announcement Banner: Preview option missing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22961].
  {panel}

When you create a custom field and give it a description, that description correctly appears under the field on all applicable screens. Editing the custom field description will work in a simple JIRA configuration (i.e. one project with one field configuration) but at some point this behaviour changed on me (I think it may have been as soon as other projects/field configurations were added). An update to the custom field description through the View Custom Field page no longer had any effect outside this page.  At this point you must edit the custom field description in all appropriate Field Configurations (System > Issue Fields > Field Configurations and open the proper field configuration)
What I find frustrating is that there is no indication of this change and I spent a lot of time trying to understand why what worked before was no longer working.

I have no issue with updating the custom field description in the appropriate Field Configurations because this provides great flexibility (although could mean a lot of work if you have a complex environment). What I am hoping you can do is something to reduce the confusion when it stops working the way it initially did.

I would suggest:
* Providing an *option* to propagate the description - allowing you to select which field configurations would be overwritten
* A warning that the change will have no effect on existing field configurations (and therefore screens).

My preference would be the first suggestion as I believe it would greatly improve the user experience.

I hope I have explained this clearly.
Regards,
Jon
fields.summary: Improve handling of custom field description updates

fields.description:
Hello folks,

I know I mentioned Greenhopper in the description. The reason that I didn't place this bug into Greenhopper project is that this behaviour happened either with Greenhopper 5.2 and 5.3, integrated with JIRA 4.2. Although Greenhopper 5.2 is not compatible with JIRA 4.2, since the behaviour could be reproduced, I'm thinking that the problem may lie within JIRA itself (since you select the "Edit in JIRA" option, which I think it uses JIRA code to handle.

At any rate, this is easily reproduceable:
* Went on Planning Board within Greenhopper
* Clicked on a card, options, and selected "Edit in JIRA"
* Clicked on the component Dropdown menu

In IE (8.0.6001) and in Chrome, the dropdown menu don't render correctly (in Chrome, it don't render at all). However, in Firefox, it renders as it should.

This behaviour was discovered through this ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/EHSP-10867

Cheers
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: "Edit in JIRA" functionality within Greenhopper fails to render the components list correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22950].
  {panel}

Hello,

Currently, when you have setup JIRA Crowd integration, and when you create a user within JIRA's User Browser, it automatically gets created inside Crowd, and there is no way avoiding it. This might be useful when you want separate groups of users using JIRA, and want only one group (your employees, for instance) to count towards your crowd license and have SSO, while other users exist inside JIRA's database and can only login JIRA. (As stated in this ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-67274

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: JIRA Crowd integration users existing only inside JIRA database
Improved Sub-Task section within the issue view

fields.description:
In the CONFDEV project on JAC, we have a component 'The Muppets' for our team. The component autocomplete doesn't work very well for me because it has a problem with multiple words in the component.

The following breaks all the time for me in Firefox 3.6:

# In the edit issue screen, click in the Component/s field
# Type "The Mu"
# The autocomplete shows my component, "The Muppets", and it is selected (see screenshot)
# Hitting enter results in the error, "the mu is not a valid component" (see screenshot)

By contrast, if you don't type the second word at all, and just enter 'The', then the autocomplete works correctly.

At a guess, I'd say that either the space key handling in the autocomplete is doing something incorrect or the behaviour when hitting enter doesn't handle multiple words correctly.
fields.summary: Hitting enter in autocomplete field doesn't work after typing component name with a space in it

fields.description:
As a Power User of Jira (I run a dev team) I would like to easily add up the values for a column for the results of a filtered list. For example I have 5 issues that show as results for the filter and the Remaining Estimate column is visible, and I want to know what the total remaining estimate is for all 5 issues. 

Some columns types are not integer and I don't know what the summary for a not integer field would look like.

This feature adds clutter so perhaps it is good for advanced users to turn on. Or perhaps hover to see total on headers would suit as an alternative
fields.summary: Power User Feature: summary data section at the end of filter results

fields.description:
['Setting Properties and Options on Startup'|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Properties+and+Options+on+Startup] section about the Linux config needs to cleaned up from unsupported app servers.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Properties+and+Options+on+Startup#SettingPropertiesandOptionsonStartup-InLinux%2Fnix%3A

Also, we should improve it and provide users with more friendly way of setting it up by adding any additional parameters in <jira_install>/bin/setenv.sh

{noformat}
#
#  Occasionally Atlassian Support may recommend that you set some specific JVM arguments.  You can use this variable below to do that.
#
JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=""
{noformat}
fields.summary: 'Setting Properties and Options on Startup' needs clean up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22942].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. David's description here is in line with the JIRA PM team's current thinking about subtasks. We want to strike a balance between more flexible parent-child hierarchies and the reasoning in Scott's original comment that having separate issue types allows for different sets of fields in the subtask.

Nevertheless, I don't expect us to address this for quite a while. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

To create what should be a simple parent-child relationship between 2 issues in JIRA, you need to define a UNIQUE sub-issue type for every single type of child issue you might want.

So lets say I have existing issue types Dev Task, Ops Task, Future Planning, QA Task, Documentation.  And I want to create a parent Documentation issue that has sub-issues for each of my depts that will be contributing:  Dev Task, Ops Task, QA Task.  I now have to create a whole new sub-issue ("sub-task") type for each of these just so I can create a proper parent child relationship between my parent issue and sub-issues.  And for each sub-issue, I have to duplicate all my previous work on the main issue types with similar names and assign all the right field configs/screens/etc, and when searching for Eng Tasks, I now have to search for both Eng Tasks and Eng Sub-Tasks.

Lets get rid of the concept of "sub-tasks" entirely, and express parent-child relationships between issues as just that -- defining a relationship -- not entirely new issue types.
fields.summary: remove sub-tasks as a unique issue type -- sub-tasks should represent a relationship, not an issue type
Enable Searching by domain of email address, either specifically by domain, or by allowing ~ operator w/reporter field

fields.description: Sometimes it happens, that if you log the effort for a task you do a typo or an another error. E.g. typing in the absolute time which is worked on a specific task or just typing a wrong number. Then the only way I found to correct this is to clone a task and delete the original task. And log the work for the cloned task again. But it should also be possible to change a wrong input.
fields.summary: Enable Resetting Effort for a Task

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+SOAP+Client has a Python example that also shows updating a Cascading Select field.

{code}
# Demonstrate setting a cascading selectlist:
        {"id": "customfield_10061", "values": ["10098"]},
        {"id": "customfield_10061_1", "values": ["10105"]},
{code}

The {{updateIssue()}} method now appears to update the parent option but not the child option.
fields.summary: Updating Cascading Select via SOAP using Python is only half-working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22932].
  {panel}

Hi,

I just upgraded from JIRA 4.1.1 to 4.2.

In 4.1.1, when I clicked on the "Comment" button at the top of the window and entered a long comment, the comment window would automatically expand so that I could see a lot of the context. In 4.2, the size of the Comment window is quite small making it difficult to enter longer comments.

From http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22046, I understand that this change in behavior was intentional. However, it is not appreciated. Our users typically add long comments and it is annoying to have to scroll all the way to the bottom of the issue to get an auto-sized comment window. The is especially true in our installation, where we have the comments sorted in descending order. The newest comment is not at the bottom of the window. It is closer to the top.

In the future, can you allow the behavior of the comment window to be a user-selectable/customizable setting? Failing that, how 'bout allowing adminstratrators to set the behavior? Or, perhaps, put a buttion next to the comment window which allows the user to allow the window to expand if they so desire?
fields.summary: Resize comment window option

fields.description: After scrolling horizontally in a gadget on the dashboard to get to the available actions (cog) icon and selecting the last record in the gadget, the available actions menu that displays workflow and operations actions will not expand the bottom border of the gadget. Execute any issue action (in dialog) by the cog, or through the dot dialog (e.g. log work, close/resolve/reopen issue). After submitting the action dialog the user sees issue navigator layout (e.g. JQL search), but no issues/notification in it. It takes up to 2 seconds for the issues to be displayed again together with the update notification. This may be confusing.
fields.summary: Bad performance of the issue navigator notifications in IE7

fields.description:
Two main cases:

h4. Covert issue to subtask.

In this the issue picker popup should not display the issue being moved or any sub-tasks. Reproduce the problem by:

# Restoring attached data.
# Goto 'HSP-1'
# Convert to Sub-task.
# Click '[Select Issues]' to bring up issue picker. Notice that only HSP-2, HSP-3, and HSP-4 is displayed (correctly). 
# Select the 'SearchRequest' from the 'Search Filter' select. Notice that HSP-3 and HSP-4 are shown (correctly). These are the only issues from 'SearchRequest' that can be parents.
# Click 'Recent Issues' link. Notice that we are now displaying all the recent issues. We should not see 'HSP-5' or 'MKY-1'.

h4. Move sub-task to new parent. 

In this the issue picker popup should not display the parent of the issue being moved or any other subtasks. Reproduce the problem by:

# Restoring attached data.
# Goto 'HSP-5'.
# Move the sub-task to a new parent.
# Click '[Select Issues]' to bring up the issue picker popup. Notice that only 'HSP-1', 'HSP-2' and 'HSP-3' are (correctly) displayed.
# Select the 'SearchRequest' from the 'Search Filter' select.
Notice that HSP-3 is shown (correctly). This issue is the only issues from 'SearchRequest' that can be the new parent.
# Click 'Recent Issues' link. Notice that we are now displaying 'MKY-1'. This issue is not allowed because it is in a different project.
fields.summary: The 'IssuePicker' popup does not display correct issues when moving between view modes

fields.description:
I thought we got this right in 4.1.2, and talking with JT, neither of us can remember an intentional change for this.

Long text fields on Create/Edit issue, such as Description and Environment, have shrunk substantially vertically - both in the initial state and in the max-height they grow to.

I recall that we limited the max-height of the bottom comment box because of the issue where it scrolled underneath the stalker, but even in 1024x768 it's far shorter than it could be, and shouldn't affect the fields in full-screen forms where there is much more space to work with.

!TextFields.PNG!
fields.summary: Text fields are much shorter than they were in 4.1.2

[^linking_keyboard.m4v]

Pt 1. 
To indicate users can create a label: 
We use: (New Label) - title case
Gmail uses: (create new) - lower case

I would recommend a compromise : (create label) - lower case
It is consistent with Gmail and our Create Issue command.

-Pt 2.-
-For multiple labels - when pasting text into Frother.-
-Can we use: (create 4 labels) to indicate the resulting behaviour-

fields.description:
When you are typing in frother elements like components, and autocomplete isn't working for you, the message is "no matches".  This is very brief, although true.

Could we be more specific and helpful?  Something like "No components found?"  It would be nice to relate the message back to what the user is trying to do.
fields.summary: FC: "No Matches" error message could be better

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce.
1. Edit an issue
2. Focus on a Frother control - doesn't matter which
3. Hit down to open the dropdown
4. Select an entry to create a lozenge
5. Hit down again to open the dropdown
6. Delete the lozenge you created using the mouse
7. The dropdown should close - hitting down no longer works to open it.

Focusing away from the field and back again or typing something opens the dropdown as normal so it's not a permanent breakage.
fields.summary: Deleting a lozenge with the mouse while the dropdown is open temporarily breaks the dropdown feature.

fields.description:

fields.description:
This is quite bizarre.

In Safari, starting from a user profile page:
1) Click on an image thumbnail in the activity stream.
2) Click back.
3) Click "Edit Details" or "Edit Preferences"

The form appears in full-page mode rather than in a dialogue.

This only reproduces in Safari, but occurs both on the Mac and on Windows.
fields.summary: Edit Details and Edit Prefs do not always appear in a dialog in Safari
